item.title: Datacratic's Machine Learning Database (MLDB)
item.description:
Description

Montreal, April 13, 2015 - Nicolas Kruchten is giving the first ever public demo of Datacratic's Machine Learning Database (MLDB): a product which is distributed as a Docker image and which uses Python as a plugin and scripting language.

  • Nicolas Kruchten: http://sflx.ca/nkrucht
  • MLDB: http://mldb.ai/
  • MP53: http://sflx.ca/mp53e

Recorded and edited live by @ChristianAubry at Montr√©al-Python 53 (Sanctified Terabit) with a little help from Savoir-faire Linux (http://sflx.ca/jobs).
item.dc:creator: Nicolas Kruchten

item.title: Make Jupyter/IPython Notebook even more magical with cell magic extensions!
item.description:
Summary

  • My talk will start out with a brief explanation of what Jupyter is (the project formerly known as IPython Notebook) and how to launch it.
  • I will demo how to run a few lines of Python in Jupyter, and how to create text cells with Markdown and LaTeX.
  • I will then demo some of the built-in 'cell magic' extensions like running bash commands and displaying plots inline.
  • I will then show some additional off-the-shelf extensions like the SQL and Graphviz ones, and show how to export a notebook to web-based slides.
  • I will then show how one can build and use a useful new cell magic extension (an interactive HTTP client) in Python, using Jupyter's built-in web-based text editor.
item.dc:creator: Nicolas Kruchten
